Among other resources available through the ICMA website and Knowledge Network, ICMA has published two related white papers prepared on behalf of its Governmental Affairs & Policy Committee, "Striking a Balance: Matching the Services Offered by Local Governments with the Revenue Realities (December 2012)" and "Coping with Crisis: How are Local Governments Reinventing Themselves in the Wake of the Great Recession? (December 2011)". Both are available for download from http://icma.org/en/icma/priorities/public_policy/policy_papers.

Sherwood, 
This article, "Recession’s Effects Intensify - Spending Cuts/Revenue Loss" (http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301688/Recessions_Effects_Intensify__Spending_CutsRevenue_Loss) discusses trends in how cities have reacted to the recession. It may be helpful for you to read through that, and then look through our documents section for more resources on the topic. 
Hope this helps! 
James Davidson

text:
This is Sherwood Edwards, Graduate Intern for the City of Aurora, Illinois. I am in need of any sources either first-hand or available in informational document about how the recent recession has changed some local governments structurally or operationally.
Thank you
title: Lessons Learned from the Recession
